Reviews.Title: “Budget Budget Budget”
Reviews.Author: bijucyborg
Reviews.Content: Three words to describe an accommodation that cant get more central in the city of Barcelona - Budget, Budget, Budget. I would not say that the hotel is cheap but considering its location I could not find a better deal. The next time I go to Barcelona I would not bother so close to the center since public transport is so efficient in the city. The staff were very friendly and courteous and were awake round the clock. The room is really really small but the bathroom was comparatively spacious. The room was cleaned and towels replaced daily. The breakfast is 8 euros but when you stay so close to La Ramblas why would one eat at the hotel. The walls do not protect against noise but when you are awake all night clubbing you hardly notice. If you are a solo traveler then this place is ok but if you are with your family then I would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for one or two nights”
Reviews.Author: Pushkathecat Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to get to from the airport. I took the Aerobus to Placa Catalunya and the hotel was diagonally across the square. Check in was no problem and the staff were polite and efficient. As I was only there overnight and leaving early morning, I settled the bill there and then. It was exactly as the easytobook.com invoice with no unpleasant surprises. I had booked a single room which was facing the inner courtyard as were all the single rooms. The room was quite small with a small double bed, bedside unit, built-in cupboard and tv on stand. It had a frosted glass window which opened and a modern ensuite bathroom. It was all very clean and there were nice little touches like toiletries and a comb in the ensuite, but unfortunately there was a distinct unpleasant smell of drains. As I didnt go in any of the other rooms, I dont know if that was confined to just my room or others on that side of the hotel as well. The only other problem I had during my stay was a few interruptions during the night with people coming in at all hours and making a racket in the corridor - it wasnt the most peaceful night's sleep by any means. I didnt sample the breakfast as I left before the restaurant opened so cant comment on that. However, as has been said in many reviews, the main redeeming feature of the hotel is the location. You really cannot get much better. There are buses and metro trains from Placa Catalunya to virtually all parts of the city and main attractions, the top of Las Ramblas is right outside the door and it is a short stroll to many superb restaurants. So in a nutshell, this hotel is exactly as it says it is: a clean, well run, fairly basic two-star hotel in an excellent location and for the price is perfectly adequate for one or two nights as a stop-over. If that is what you are after I would recommend it, but not if you are planning a family holiday or a romantic weekend for two.

Reviews.Title: “MONEGAL HOTEL, BARCELONA”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, surprised to find the reception at the back of a watch shop, but never the less, the reception staff were very helpful, spoke english, and showed us the sights to see. The rooms were basic, breakfast was great value, and the location was superb. We were on the 4th floor, at the front overlooking the Placa de la Catalunya. La Rambla was adjacent to the hotel. Walking along the Placa ge Gracia and sitting in the Placa de Catalunya made our holiday in Barcalona. I would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to discover Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Orestes P
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It was right beside a subway station, Plaza Catalunya and right beside La Rambla. You can walk along this famous street of Barcelona and be always close to you hotel. The breakfast was not that good but the price of the hotel per room was excellent. The Hotel offer a discount for the Hop on/Hop off buses in Barcelona which is totally worth it. With these buses you can discover all Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: PanamaGeorge
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced, clean and friendly hotel located on Plaza Catalunya at the top of the Rambla

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location average rooms”
Reviews.Author: TrishandStry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to a Cruise for two nights with Friends and I must say that it truly has a fantastic location. Right on the corner of Las Ramblas metres away from fantastic restuarants and bars and everything you could possibly want. The rooms are average but clean and the staff is extremley helpful with anything you might need. A word of warning though - it can get very noisy due to its location! If you are a light sleeper you might want to book an iniside room. All in all a great place to have as a base in Barcelona to explore the city at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Nasty Hotel. Would recommend no one to stay there”
Reviews.Author: IrelandSiobhan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently. It is the most disgusting filthy smelly place I have ever stayed. I cannot imagine who would give this place a good review. The doors and walls are paper thin. You really do not feel safe staying in the room. It can get really hot and the air con is crap and noisy. There was vomit in the hall and the staff did not seem bothered. The told us leave our bags down in the dungeon behind the reception. It's not safe to go down there. There are about twenty tiny steep steps. I am amazed the owners are allowed get away with this. Do yourself a favour and book someone else !

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Sergeant1192
Reviews.Content: I stayerd here for two nights last week - the real selling point is the location Staff were friendly and helpful - the room was pleasant and clean Barcelona never felt better than here

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: nmathewson
Reviews.Content: It wasn't too hard to find as it was signposted, however you do have to walk through a jewellery store to get to it... or maybe it was just that the jewellery store was located in it's 'reception' area. Odd. The room was really small and run down. The one and only window was frosted glass, so we opened it to see what was on the other side, it was looking into a disgusting central opening in building, pipes and dirt everywhere... that explains why the window was frosted! The bed looked tired and worn and we questioned whether there would be bed bugs in it. It was an uncomfortable sleep as well. The bathroom was clean so at least that was a bonus. The breakfast wasn't worth it, the coffee was disgusting, I'd recommend heading out and buying something real from any local cafe and bypass the hotel breakfast. Location of the hotel was good if you want to be near old town. It's at the top of La Ramblas and there are a lot of warnings of pickpockets, but it's fine if you are simply aware and take necessary precautions - like wear your backpack or bag on the front. The end of La Ramblas has a few strip clubs so I'm sure it would be dodgy at night time just like other reviewers say. We avoided it at night time so we never saw any of that. I wouldn't recommend the hotel due to the quality of the room and breakfast, there are plenty of other options around.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Willie S
Reviews.Content: if you are a traveller like i do you only sleep in your hotel room, you dont stay in one. this hotel is right in the middle of barcelona, on the bus route from the airport and right on la rambla. it was so central, we could not believe our eyes when weh saw its location. the views from the hotel room across the square is stunning as well! The rooms are not big, but the location makes it all worth while! No better place to stay in Barcelona is you want to explore the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: VenuSalsa
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in the early morning we could check-in right away, although the check-in time mentioned in their info was actually around noon. The room we got was on the back on the 2nd floor (201). The room was clean and perfectly spacious enough to have a city trip. There was a balcony, but unfortunately the smell and heat from some pipe coming from either Burger King or MacDonalds was so overwhelming that we had to keep the door to the balcony closed. This wasn't bothering us that much, since we had a perfectly working A/C. The next day we did ask if we could get a room on the front, which would be nice also because of the view on the Placa Catalunya/Ramblas. Without any problem we received the keys for room 212, just across the hall from our room. This room had a balcony and view to the front and was just as clean as the other room and slightly bigger. We spend our dowtime with some sangria watching people on the balcony. Also in none of the rooms, so also not in the frontroom, did we have any problems with noise. We slept like babies! Basically the location is REALLY excellent, the service of the reception desk is just as excellent. Some rooms do have a bad situation, but the rooms in itself are clean, functional and big enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: 18TillIDie
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd time in Barcelona but first for the two friends who came with us. On both previous occasions we stayed in different hotels, but Medium Monegal is definitely the best of the three. Location couldn't be better right at the top of La Rambla where it meets Placa de Catalunya. Rooms big enough and well equipped. Couldn't fault cleanliness. Reception staff friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Right on the money for family of 4 ... central, adequate, internet”
Reviews.Author: maryangell
Reviews.Content: For one or two nights, great for the price. Great view out on La Rambla and Catalunya. Central location - walkable to everything downtown, secured wireless internet. We are currently staying in the Monegal, and we really don't have any complaints other than the floor could be a bit cleaner. We are a family of 4, and we're renting a double room for one night: 2 single beds pushed together. They brought in an extra bed for our daughter (4 yrs). I think it will cost about 30 euros extra - not sure it that's for the night or for the entire stay. And they brought in a crib (cot - like a pack n play) - free of charge - for our son (16 mos). To provide our son a separate space, we were able to fit the pack n play in the bathroom, and he's happily asleep. We're paying 140 euros for a night, and although we're facing La Rambla from the 2nd floor, and we can hear the noise, it's muffled enough that our children can sleep through it, and we'll be able to as well. A continental breakfast is included. The Aerobus - a direct bus service from Catalunya to the airport (BCN) that doesn't require advanced ticket purchase - think Hop on Hop off Tourist bus like - picks up about a 5 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best location ever in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: HelsinkiJom
Reviews.Content: Inspite of the very central location, the hotel entrance was more than complicated to find in the corner of C.Pelayo and Las Ramblas. Just when realized that you have to pass a small shop and use the same entrance with a gay sauna, you could find your bed. No matter passing the shop or gay sauna door, just difficult to find. The rooms facing Pl. Catalonia had an excellent view and of course quite a noise during all day and night. So interesting view to Las Ramblas showing a kind of reality TV, especially in the night hours. The rooms were small, very small and worn out. The corridors and the breakfast room were also worn out and not cosy at all. I do disagree their two stars! I would give them hardly one and that would be for the location. The room toilet, like the whole building inside was quite horrible. But in case just enjoying the city and beeing out all the day and night, why not this accommodation... So the room price was absolutely too high, I said absolutely too high. 96 Eur per night for a miserable sleeping facility. I would better appreciate some 40 Eur per night for that kind of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean and very well located!”
Reviews.Author: besugo
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It's right in Plaça de Catalunya and up La Rambla! A strange thing is that you have to pass through a watch shop in order to get the reception. But after a couple of days, you get used to it ;) The staff is friendly, breakfast is more than enough for a two star hotel, and the room is very small, but clean. In my opinion, the worst about this hotel is the noise coming from outside of the room. You can listen to almost everything in your floor and in the stairs so, if you have problems falling asleep, you should bring earplugs :)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, small and over-expensive”
Reviews.Author: JoEm69
Reviews.Content: Had booked a 4 night stay here for 500 € which is a lot for a 2* hotel, but we were hoping that the stars were lying. When we arrived we understood that they were, but not in the good way. The lobby was littered with paper on the floor. The elevator was so slow that it was faster taking the stairs. The halls felt dirty, the room as well, allthough the bed-linnen was clean. However, the whole hotel was so worn down that you could not tell whether it as clean or not. The safe is a joke. You have to pay for a key, 3€/night, and you can buy a key for this in any hardware shop. The location was the only thing that was good, but not worth more than 30-40 Euros a night. This is actually a 1* hotel that charges a premium price. Stay away. We stayed only one night . We learned one thing: "Don't book too quick. Do more research"

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP AND CHEERFUL, NICEST AND MOST HELPFUL STAFF YOU COULD ASK FOR”
Reviews.Author: travelleracp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights during June, when I arrived I was checking in alone and had lost my suitcase and passport so was naturally distressed. The staff on reception where so helpful and kind, they rang many Spanish companies to try and recover my possessions and helped me with my trip to the British Consulate. The hotel itself isn't grand but it's clean and cheap and has a flat screen tv in the bedroom (which surprised me for a 2* hotel), it has a nice clean bathroom with ample facilities. It's location is fantastic it's in the middle of Catalunya right on the Ramblas. Would definately recommend this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: banebt
Reviews.Content: OK i have been to many hotels in most non-mainstream countries and in popular places and i have seen bad Service but this service sets new standards in BAD!!! First don't be fooled by breakfast included: The maid who is cleaning the room is also the "chef" and preparing the breakfast which is old croissant and chocolate cream and juice that does not have more than 5% fruit inside from which you instantly get acid reflux. The same person (that is the maid and fixing the breakfast) came to fix the door as well. The receptionist...that was the zen of my stay....it was some guy in late 40ties he was playing game at the pc and wasn't even bothering to look at you when you asked smthg. Our friends (couple) were staying in other hotel which was not in the centre..we were out and the waiter spieled some drinks on my friend's girlfriend...because our hotel was much closer to theirs, the girl i was staying with, offered to give some t-shirt from her instead to go to their hotel...but that was a problem for the receptionist who asked another 50 euros (1 night stay) if they want to come up...we told him that its just 2 minutes to change her shirt but he didn't care and said no more than 2 ppl are allowed in the room...Ok we said, so can just the two girls go..he was thinking and he said yes....so me and my friend were waiting down like idiots and i had to wait for the girls to come so i can go and use the bathroom of my room(coz they don't have at the reception, at least not for customers ). The only good thing is the location but i would rather travel 1h than have this awful service

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL, WORST HOTEL EVER.”
Reviews.Author: DublinJoanna71
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night with my husband and family. I booked the hotel as I found it very hard to book a hotel in barcelona for one night. Most hotels have a minimum of three night stay. I can safely say it was the worst hotel I ever stayed in my life. Infact I don't think it should be called a hotel, its like a very bad hostel. The place is filthy. The lift is tiny so basically you have to walk up the stairs. I was on the fifth floor. There is no bar or any kind of communal area. You enter the hotel by a dirty narrow hallway. The location is central but believe me the streets outside are cleaner and probably safer than this hotel. The walls are like paper and you can hear the people next door clearly. There were hairs on my sheets. There was sick on the stairs, where I went to tell the reception. They said "No Comprendz". This "hotel" should come with a health warning. NO MATTER HOW DESPERATE YOU ARE, DO NOT BOOK THIS HELL HOLE. It ruined my trip to Barcelona as the thoughts of going back there made me feel ill.

Reviews.Title: “As central as you will get”
Reviews.Author: themudgeerambler
Reviews.Content: Booked here for our final night in Spain, mainly because it gave us a chance to do some shopping and wander the Ramblas which we didnt do before. it is also very close to the excellent airport bus service on the other side of Placa Catalunya. Our room overlooked both La Rambla and Placa Catalunya. The view was great, the noise was not. The windows are not double glazed and dont mask any sound. This became a bit of a dilemna at night with 100,000 plus ecstatic Barcelona Football supporters partying outside the window. The positive side was we had the best seat in the house to enjoy it. The room itself was clean and a reasonable size and the staff were Ok. It was expensive enough 120E for what it was but not ridiculous

Reviews.Title: “perfect location! very recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: rotemkat
Reviews.Content: great hotel, perfect location. (just above the corner of la-rambla & plaza catalonia) the staff was kind. our room was very clean and quite big, with a balcony to the Rambla! the bad things: very small and ugly lobby. the elevator soooooo slow...

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandStewarts
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this hotel, we wouldn't have stayed anywhere else. Our first stay was about five years ago. At that time I noted that the breakfast was pretty dismal.....well, it's improved a lot. The rooms are unexciting but clean and comfortable. It's not until you open the curtains that you truly appreciate this place. Ask for a front facing room with a balcony (I think all the front facing rooms have them, but just to be sure, ask). It's just magical for people watching, particularly at night with a glass of wine in your hand. Because of it's location, the rooms can be noisy, though the windows and curtains block out a lot. I knew this so took earplugs and slept fine All public transport runs from outside the hotel, and a huge array of shopping, cafes and restaurants are on the doorstep.. The reception staff are excellent and speak very good English. Extremely helpful with any kind of query. If I ever go back to Barcelona, this is definitely where I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: chicLarkhall Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent position,room was small but clean , saff very helpful and friendly would recommend for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiernan86
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at The Monegal Medium Hotel. After landing at El Prat airport we got the bus to Placa Catalunya (centre of Barcelona). The Hotel is also on the same square so it was literally a 1 minute walk from the bus stop. After being allocated a room at the back of the hotel we went to reception to request a room with a view of Placa Catalunya. The receptionist changed our room without any hesitation. Staff were quite cordial and very helpful regarding directions. Our room and bathroom were spotlessly clean, we had a Samsung flat-screen TV, and a small balcony with a great view of the square and La Rambla. In general the room was reasonably comfortable and the shower was good also. The twin room was quite inexpensive, only £24 each per night. The Monegal does have a rather strange set up - you have to walk through a jewelry store to get to reception and some of the upper floors seem to share the premises with other businesses but don't let this put you off. In terms of location, it doesn't get any more central than this, the hotel is right on La Rambla and close enough to all of the major attractions Barcelona has to offer. We used the Tourist Bus (Bus Turisitic) to see most of the major sights and we even got a discount for our bus tickets at the hotel. The tourist bus leaves every few minutes almost right outside the hotel. We also used the Metro stop outside our hotel to get about, its relatively inexpensive in comparison to the Tube in London and quite easy to navigate your way around. The best method of travel in Barcelona is on foot, as you will see so much more. Close to the hotel is La Boqueria de San Josep, the largest food market in Spain. La Boqueria has hundreds of stalls selling fresh fruit, meat, fish and wine. There are also some great Tapas restaurants here such as El Quim and one known simply as La Boqueria. Behind the hotel is a maze of backstreets that retain their old world rustic charm and an 18th century Baroque style church called Iglesia de Sant Agusti which is also worth visiting. The Rambla outside the hotel is noisy 24/7 and the walls are quite thin but bring ear plugs and you should sleep fine. I'd advise against eating on La Rambla as food/drink prices are much higher than a few streets away and your less likely to get authentic tapas, however the large supermarket on La Rambla is quite cheap. Take care with your money and belongings as pick-pocketing is rife, although we didn't experience anything of that nature during our stay. Restaurants worth visiting are La Tropezon in the Gothic Quarter, Can Pep also in the Gothic Quarter and El Quim in La Boqueria. In terms of sights to visit, Park Guel and Sagrada Familia are stunning. In closing, if you want a decent hotel that's slap bang in the centre of Barcelona and one which is very reasonably priced then The Monegal is for you. This is a great base to see the city and chances are you will spend most of your time out exploring what Barca has to offer. Barcelona is a beautiful city with lots of amazing sights and restaurants and we hope to return shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the heart of Barcelona and take the room number 210!”
Reviews.Author: Ozlem_Ozen
Reviews.Content: I always prefer to stay in a very centered place even if the conditions are not optimum. For a city visit, like Barcelona, the location is my number one priority. Before I got this hotel I made a huge research and decided this was my hotel to stay. It is in the heart of Barcelona, just in the beginning of Las Ramlas and near everything that gave us the opportunity to walk anywhere.. Dont expect the luxury, but a clean, comfortable room and a friendly stuff that helps at every time you adress. I stayed at the room no 210 (which was the biggest I guess) and had a great view of Plaza Catalunya under my feet :) I dont know about the other rooms but I assure you, if you stay at this room, you wont regret it! p.S: If you cant sleep in a noisy place, dont consider. I was lucky that I had my ear plugs :)

Reviews.Title: “cheap and friendly”
Reviews.Author: swissdixon
Reviews.Content: no complaints. good location,good hotel,good service.20 yards from the Hard Rock Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loved Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: fawky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2009 (I'm a little slow in writing my review, sorry). The hotel is in the best position on Las Ramblas, and across the road from Plaza Catalunya. The room was a good size and the bathroom too. The whole hotel is tiled throughout so noise travels throughout which is a little annoying if it's kids voices echoing through... There was 2 young people on reception when we got there and they were really nice. They even leant us a corkscrew later that night to open our wine! On our first morning, a different lady was on reception, also very helpful. She gave us a good tip for brekky - Viena - a little cafe along Las Ramblas. It was perfect, we went there every morning for brekky that we were there. Las Ramblas is always noisy, but so entertaining. Our room had a little balcony that we could stand out on and watch all the happenings below and we loved it. The windows block out surprisingly a lot of noise. I'm a light sleeper and put earplugs in and slept fine. My husband didn't need earplugs though. All in all, a great stay in Barcelona. Also, La Boqueria markets are down the road a little and they're awesome. You don't even have to buy anything. We had fun just wandering around.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value”
Reviews.Author: violaine173
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night and it was way to expensive for what we paid. 140 Euro for a basic room on the roof (elevator stops at 4th floor) where you actually say only for sleeping is too much, especialy when they is mold ont the celling. The staff at the front was inpersonal. We moved to a 1 star hotel 2 streets away and for 65 E per night, we had a smile, internet and a friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “basic but fine”
Reviews.Author: ghh3000
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is fantastic just off La Rambla and on the place Catalunya...a tourist could not ask for better in Barcelona. The rooms are not large but they are clean and have all you need to sleep and recharge. I would recommend this place, as long as you don't pay rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: jjua543
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days on a two week trip in Spain. Location was great. Just as the description said steps away from Las Rablas... The set up is a bit weird as you have to enter through a watch shop to get to the reception desk and stairs, but oh well. The room was clean, had two twin beds, an extra large bathroom, some storage closets, air conditioning and small balcony. The balcony, only source of light and fresh air, was small and faced the courtyard and neighbor's rooftop patio. Staff was very nice and helpful.Breakfast was worth the extra 5 euro per person per day. I would recommend the hotel and would not mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: florencialukuc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Medium Monegal at the end of may for 3 nights. My boyfriend and I loved the place, specially the location. From the airport we found a shuttle bus that brought us to Plaza Catalunya (last stop) and we only paid 5 euros. the hotel is situated across the street from the plaza, at the beggining of the famous La Rambla. We stayed in room 210, if you can stay there! its the corner room, so its very big and you have the best view! the breakfast is cheap and very simple, but good. The room has a safe and it is very clean although it is a little old. The staff at the front desk were very helpfull and gave us all sorts of maps. Also the night life is really happening @ La Rambla. It is very noisy all night We also went to the beach, try to avoid Bercelonetta as it is filled with kids n tourists... we went to Mar Bella, a little bit further away, and the hop on hop off bus tour brought us there (blue line and 2 min walk). Also, watch out for pick pocketters!!! they are everywhere even if you cant see them. We wew lucky nothing happened to us but it almoust did, there is a lady always wearing the same thing, pretends that she s crying and somebody stole her wallet...ignore her!!! shes a liar! we saw her 2 days in a row and people felt bad so gave her money! Enjoy your Stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: arahbaby
Reviews.Content: If I can sum-up why I super enjoyed my stay in this hotel, it's because of its LOCATION!!! There's nothing more I can ask for. It's across the La Ramblas where all the nice restos and stores can be found. They have different street performers, vendors, and mostly packed with people. Tourists and locals alike. It's also within Plaza Catalunya where all the tourists bus stop so it's very convenient! It's not hard to find since it's between a 4-floor H&M store and a Zara store. There's even a train station just outside the hotel's entrance! Free WIFI which is perfect since I was there on a business trip. Toiletries are refilled everyday. Price was reasonable compared to other hotels within the vicinity. Cold breakfast so better buy your own ham at the nearest grocery store to match your bread and cereals.

Reviews.Title: “Very deceiving photos!”
Reviews.Author: FunFarm
Reviews.Content: The entrance to the street was not as pictured at all. Street front entrance with tiny, tiny front desk. No windows to the outside from room except onto what appeared to be a shaft where some trash was tossed....Ish......Lift didn't work. Doubt if it has ever worked!

Reviews.Title: “nice friendly staff but poor room no window to outside, and noise from other guests travelled.”
Reviews.Author: madphysio
Reviews.Content: We chose this as it is in a good location right near the Plaza catalunya, The room and bathroom was clean. The staff friendly and spoke good English. However the room was off a shaft where no natural air circulated, and daylight very very restricted. It was uncomfortable to be in for any length of time therefore. We didnt try the breakfast so can't comment on this. Every sound travelled down the tiled corridor and the room noise and the plumbing sounds were clearly audible. It was not condusive to a good nights sleep despite the beds and pillows being fairly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: eggs88
Reviews.Content: Great location, good price, helpful staff. Tiny room by US standards (average for European standards) but nice bathroom. Window view of brick wall, but don't go to Barcelona to look out the hotel room, explore this beautiful city !

Reviews.Title: “great location, easy accsess”
Reviews.Author: DaniM24
Reviews.Content: the room I had, was phenomenal, and the view made my day

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Not even one complaint!”
Reviews.Author: Frankie1234
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews about this place and then visiting it, I thought "God, why is everyone so darn picky!" It really has nothing to be complained about. Absolutely PERFECT location, it is in a very very busy area so no need to feel scared about being in a dodgy alley way (as my Mum was worried about), it is ON the La Rambla high street, it is ON the Piaza Catalunya (with 2 amaaazing fountains), it is inbetween a McDonalds and a Burger King (lol) and surrounded by H&M, Zara, Mango and Topshop even! Gorgeous little coffee bar right outside the hotel (could see it from our balcony) where my mum and I had breakfast twice during our 3-day stay there.....lovely croisants, fresh orange juice and coffees.....we even went for a drink there one evening and sat outside until 11pm just people watching and it was fantastic! Hard Rock Cafe (Restaurant) and loads more cafes and shops about 100m away, if that. Massive 9 storie department store right opposite the hotel (bit like Debenhams). Bus and taxi rank right outside in the Piaza Catalunya, including the City Tour bus which we went on. The hotel offers a discount from 21 Euros to 15 Euros if you decide to go on the City Tour bus (DEFFINITELY worth more than 15 Euros, it was AMAZING!) Rooms were fantastic, not even one complaint in all honesty. Bed sheets changed and beds made fresh every single day. Bathroom towels changed every single day and minature shampoos, soaps and toilet roll put in every day even though we hadn't run out. Staff extremely helpful, answered all our questions, excellent English indeed, really happy to help you and consider your safety. This hotel truly made our 4-day stay in Barcelona and put my Mum and myself at ease about being in a busy city by ourselves. Mum is even thinking of going back with Dad and staying at the hotel again, the location just did it for us!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right by Plaça Cataluña (the Rambla is right outside the hotel). Whether it is a good location or not can be discussed but if you are there for an extended weekend (like we were) the location is convenient. There is a subway station (Plaça Cataluña) right next to the hotel and the buses from the airport arrive (and leave) from Plaça Cataluña. The hotel was a bit difficult to find since the entrance is also a jewellery/watch store and there is also a sign regarding some type of sauna club (which is in the same building). The staff at the front desk were friendly and spoke English. They were not overly helpful, they did not manage to get any useful information regarding bars etc but they managed to provide correct information on public transport and such. The room was larger than expected. It had a small TV, a desk and two beds. Everything seemed clean although a bit run-down. I did not particularly like the detergent they used (smelled rather strong) but at least it was clear that they had at least washed everything (towels, linen etc). The bathroom was also bigger than I expected (considering the pretty low price €60 per night for two people). It had a bath tub and they actually also provided shampoo, shower gel and soap. It had the same worn feeling as the rest of the room (and the hotel in general) but it was clean. The room we got also had a small balcony facing the back. Luckily we did not have any window facing the street, we did however still hear a lot of noise from the surrounding rooms (the walls and the door seemed to be paper thin) so light sleepers should bring earplugs. From what I understood there was wifi available at the hotel (did not test it myself) but there was no minibar or fridge in the room. I also missed some type of safe in the room (did not ask at the reception if I could store stuff there) especially since the door seemed to be so thin that it could easily be kicked or even pushed down. All things considered the hotel is very good considering the low price but it is a bit worn and it totally lacks any charm or warmth so if that is what you value there are other better options. This is however the perfect choice if you want a central location and a cheap and clean place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Stay esewhere... Unless you just need a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: xmasbaby63
Reviews.Content: Yes its a great location but there are lots of hotels in this area. Cold institutional and dorm-like... This place is depressing. If you are coming here for a one- time trip - the savings is not worth it. We have traveled everywhere and found great deals on modest hotels with warmth and charm which this has none of. I wish someone had written this type of review as i would have made another choice.thebreakfast was bad too

Reviews.Title: “Clean room reasonable price and terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Werlein_Manor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Placa Catalunya which means it is right in the center of Barcelona and if you are a tourist that is simply as good as it gets. The pedestrian street La Ramblas is about 20 feet out the front door. The hotel is a bit odd. The entrance is through a jewelry store with the hotel reception desk tucked in there with an elevator that holds three people only. The room actually start on about the 3 or 4th floor so if you are in a room that is 200 something you are really higher than you think. You do NOT want to be on the front of the hotel. The rooms at the back don't have much of a few but they are very quiet - despite the fact you are tucked in the middle of the tourist area. I was traveling with two friends they were in sincle rooms 400 and 219 and at the back and quiet. My wife and I were in 221 a double and it was also quiet. Breakfast is continental coffee and juice and various breads... some yogart but it is pretty cheap - worth it probably for the convenience. Free wireless internet that works reasonably well. The rooms (especially the singles) were small but clean. The bath rooms were bigger than average and had recently been done so that they had moder fixtures and even a bidet. The staff was mostly young, helpful and friendly. There were one or two that were grumpy on night duty - but the other compensated for it. If you are interested in clean and centrally located this is a great hotel. It is ecencentric a bit - but - don't be put off but the odd lobby arangement. You could pay nearly double and not have this good a location. I booked this one I think from Expedia - which I got to from Trip Advisor and got a good rate for the third week in April. A great time to visit Barcelona. I would be leary of this hotel in the heat of the summer they have AC vents in the room but not sure how well it works. In spring - it was lovely and cool and not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordable and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Apadah
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, only complaint I would have is the noise from the street, the single paned glass just doesnt keep out the noise of traffic. Having that said everything else was great, at the top of las ramblas it has everything in easy reach, hotel staff were very nice and cleaners came every day! Barcelona is beautiful...but expensive! and watch out for pick pockets, they really are EVERYWHERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful”
Reviews.Author: donaldgregoryBelfast
Reviews.Content: I was passing thro Barcelona and as before booked into this hotel. However I made a mistake and had booked into another of this groups hotels in Barcelona. Rather than get a taxi to the other hotel the staff phoned the other hotel and cancelled my booking so I had no penalty to pay by staying here. That saved a lot of hassle. Generally I would agree with the other positive comments on Tripadvisor re this hotel and next time in Barcelona I will most certainly stay here

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, Affordable, & Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Antimagellan
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Location, Value, Staff Negatives: Decor, Hard Beds, Noise from the Plaza Overlooking Catalunya Plaza, the location couldn't be better. The access to the Metro is outside the hotel entrance, the Aerobus from the airport stops across the Plaza (for the Hotel entrance look across the Plaza for the McDonald's and Burger King signs). The hotel reception is at the back of a jewelry store. We never had any trouble getting in or out. There is a three person elevator that moves slowly but does the job. The stairs themselves are marble and worn on the first two flights (a slip hazard if you aren't careful). Our room was a twin bedded ensuite room with high celings and double doors which opened onto to a tiny balcony facing the Plaza. Noise was an issue as Catalunya Plaza and Las Rambles are active 24 hours a day. If noise bothers you, you may wish to request a room away from the Plaza. The decor is dated and struck me as masculine (tidy guy dorm ambience?). The weather was beautiful so we didn't need the available A/C or heat. The twin beds came with a bedspread, two blankets, and a decent king size pillow. The mattress was very firm. There is room to walk on either side and between the beds - actually walk not squeeze. There is plenty of storage, but no drawers. The closet, which is in the entry area of the room, had shelves and a hanging area for our clothes with room left over for two pieces of luggage. There is a room safe in the closet which we did not use since it seemed to require a key we did not have. In addition there is a built in desk and luggage rack (you can fit 4 pieces of luggage in this room without it ever getting in your way). The phone rests on the shelf between the beds. There are overhead lights as well as a reading light and a desk lamp. The website says there is free internet but we did not try to access it so I cannot comment on the speed or reliability. The bathroom was clean and European small but not tiny. The bathtub was cute - full depth and width but only about 4 feet long. Water pressure was good but not invigorating. There was plenty of hot water. They provided small soaps and shampoos. I spotted a hair dryer behind the hotel desk that looked like it might be available for guests but there is not one in the room. The bathroom lighting is adequate but noisy as the single switch always turns on the light and the fan. Some of the rooms in the hotel share a bath down the hall. The common bath had a little bit longer tub, toilet, sink, and bidet. My 18 year old college daughter and I agreed it would not have been a problem to use that bathroom if our room was not ensuite. The maid cleaned daily and left a new body and face towel, each time. We had no trouble with theft over our 7 day stay, even when my daughter left two rings on the sink while we went out one day. The breakfast was €5 per person and available until 11:30 a.m. I thought it was a decent deal for when we wanted breakfast but we did not want to duck around the corner to Las Rambles. Breakfast included multiple baskets of a variety of pastries, butter, jelly, cereals, milk, yogurt, coffee, tea, hot chocolate (packets), orange juice and grapefruit juice. Meats and fruit were not offered. The staff was always pleasant, welcoming, and helpful. All spoke some English, some spoke a lot of English so we never had communication problems. The hotel allowed us to leave our luggage for several hours after our 12 noon checkout (it required us taking them down the most narrow and scary twisty staircase I've ever been on). This hotel is simple, clean, affordable, and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel for location and price, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: zf999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situtated right on Las Ramblas on one of the main squares, everything is on your doorstep including the airport bus which stops at the other side of the square. (Also Burger King and McDonalds downstairs for us English plebs!). Entrance is shared with a jewel shop but this caused no probs and you can buzz to be let in late. The rooms are basic but actually very nice- clean and safe. Bathroom was huge. We were initially disappointed that our room was situated at the back of the hotel but it was very peaceful so perhaps this was for the best. We had breakfast included which was cereals, yoghurt, pastries, toast, coffee, juice etc..only thing missing that would have been nice maybe some cheese/cold meats, but otherwise great. Only other slight complaint was food/drink vending machines were advertised but only drinks were available, not best pleased at 2am after a night of euro beers with McDonalds shut!

Reviews.Title: “It's location makes this hotel a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Lancs7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in last week. Its location is amazing right out of the front door onto Las Rambles this is the reason for grading it very good overall. On arrival the first room we were given was dirty. We complained and the staff couldn't have been more helpful offering us several other rooms to choose from.The rooms are small and a room at the back meant we had no view but it was quiet. It was basic but we didn't pay a fortune to stay there so we felt we got what we paid for. We didn't opt for breakfast there are lots of places on Las Rambles offering it. Alternatively check out the market down Las Rambles on the right where they sell an amazing array of fruit and smoothies! At the hotel take the lift to the 4th floor and walk upto the firth here you can get out onto the roof terrace which has some amazing views over the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: kapo69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monegal for four nights after getting a great rate through an Internet booking service. Best value for money I've found at a hotel for years. It's only a two-star, which shows in a somewhat worn appearance, and the fact that breakfast isn't included. But the desk staff are very friendly (and speak English), the rooms are clean, and while the rooms aren't exactly large, they're about the same size in many three-star Barcelona hotels. And if you're into the old part of the city around the Rambla, you can't beat the Monegal for location. It's situated on the corner of Placa de Catalunya, at the end of the Rambla, right next to a major Metro station, just across the Placa from the airport bus, and with a multitude of restaurants, cafés and shopping opportunities nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: hami1979
Reviews.Content: Location of Medium hotel in Barcelona is amazing: it is right on Plaza Catalunya, which is next to all bus stops, main subway station and La Ramblas. This central location allowed us to make stops during the day, for example, to change shoes when it was raining, and we could walk everywhere without any need to take subway or a bus. (And if we wanted to, transportation is right there) Entrance to the hotel is shared with some watch store so if you arrive before the store opens/after it closes, you have to use a buzzer and ask reception to let you in. We did not know that and were really confused as we did not find the buzzer right away:) I would say the room was average at best. You can't say it's dirty but it does not seem clean either. Everything is dull and kind of shabby. The bed was clean though. In the washroom, painting of the walls is old, the shower is old and water pressure is really weak. The room had a balcony overlooking plaza Catalunya which is a nice view. Staff was very nice - always helpful, answering all our questions, giving us detailed directions when we asked for that. All of them spoke very good English. Overall, I think this hotel is ok for people who don't spend much time in the room, like us -we were out sightseeing all day and only returned to the hotel to sleep. If you are looking for a cosy hotel, say, for a romantic getaway, I would not recommend Medium. I still think for 99 Euros per night (a double room) in the end of October we could find something better (maybe in a less central location)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - NOISY ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: avjwc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the best location for visiting Barcelona. It's at the top of the Rambas and at a big metro stop. All the shopping is around the same area. You can easily walk to the end of the Rambas in 15 minutes. Keep in mind the hotel is only 2 stars. The furniture and bedding is very simple and old. The windows are SINGLE pane so the traffic noise outside is extremely loud. We had to sleep with EAR PLUGS. But we had the best view in the entire hotel. Room 420 is on the top floor with a full wall of windows overlooking plaza Catalyuna. We couldn't ask for a better view. Too bad the hotel is so old. If they upgrade the windows and the furniture, the hotel could charge a lot more. We paid about 79 Euros a night which included free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: sarahdrew
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a whistle stop stay in Barcelona. The hotel is right on the corner of la ramblas and as such has everything you need on your door step. The hotel itself is a bit shabby but the views (if you are on the front) are what you are paying for. It was clean and the staff are very helpful. We asked for a balcony room when we got there and the lady very kindly moved us. It was noisey at night but hey its a city centre. Top Tip: dont buy drinks or food from the outside bars/ resturants on la rambla - we were charged 25 euros for a glass of sangria and two small glasses of white wine!! All in all though the hotel was great for what we needed and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DimasPlymouthUK
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay and the location of this hotel is perfect, right on the corner of the Placa Catalunya and the Ramblas with the Metro / tourist bus / airport bus all within a couple of minutes walk. We were on the 2nd floor with views over the Placa and Ramblas. It was quite noisy but the double glazing blocked most of it out! Room was spotlessly clean and the staff were really helpful. Be warned though if you have mobility problems - the lift was not always working and did not serve the ground floor all the time we were there - we had to walk up to a mezzanine floor each time.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: travels43
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff and a great location. You are on catalunya square which is near all the bus stops including aerobus. We got a room at the back of the hotel so we didn't hear any noise. The rooms have aircon so I guess if you stay at the front you can still keep the windows closed. It's a great basic room which is very clean. I would definitely go and stay there again, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wounderful staff”
Reviews.Author: brokernu2
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Medium Monegal. Glad I read previous reviews, as the front desk area is a bit hidden, we had no trouble finding it. The desk staff were all terrific, great suggestions, good english, help with reservations, etc. We had a large room overlooking the Placa Catalunya and all the activity below, it was great. Metro subway just outside the door, very convenient ,cabs across the street, and airport direct bus stop right on the plaza. Lots of good restaurants & shops near by. Large bathroom with full shower was nice. Good location for a base to go out & visit museums and other cultural attractions. Their breakfast starts early, for Barcelona time, which is great if you're an early riser & miss your coffee.

Reviews.Title: “The Attic Rooms are a GREAT deal”
Reviews.Author: skinnyglassesgirl
Reviews.Content: Great location on Las Ramblas. We got one of the attico rooms upstairs on the top floor by walking in and asking if they had any cheap rooms available. There were 3 rooms that had to share a bath on this level and you had to take the elevator up to the top floor and then go up one short set of stairs to get to these rooms. These rooms had just been remodeled as had the shared bathroom. They were very clean and well-kept. AC worked very well. There was a TV and a phone. Our room was incredibly quiet which is a great find for any hotel on Las Ramblas. You can't book the attico rooms online...you must contact the hotel directly. Most rooms in this hotel were going for over 120 euros a night and we got this room for 55 euros. GREAT DEAL! Staff was very helpful, too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: weisertravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 1 night. The location was perfect and the room was good. We had a very nice room on the 4th floor that overlooked the Plaza. Because of our location, the sound from the street was pretty loud when trying to sleep, but we didn't mind since we knew that was something we might encounter with the central location. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The price for the 1 night was an excellent deal, but skyrocketed for the second night so we decided to stay elsewhere. If you can get a good price, this is an excellent hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: I Just returned from spain where I stayed 1 week at the Hotel Monegal. It is a very basic hotel with a decent size room and fairly large bathroom. Plenty of hot water and good Air Conditioning. Something the hotel in sitges where I stayed lacked. The room is perfect for sleeping but it is not overly comfortable for just relaxing in the room. The room is very clean but very plain. I would say the staff is very friendly. The location is prime. Not sure if I would stay here again because barcelona has so many hotels but not a bad hotel either. Expect a 2 star hotel and you will be happy but do not expect too much either.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, not so nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: deniz19801
Reviews.Content: The location was really gret, it was in a walking distance to all the major locations. However the hotel itself is not so good. The elevator was always out of order and we had to carry the luggage to 4th floor which was really inconvenient. The rooms are not so nice and warm. The breakfast is not good either. I would prefer to pay a little bit more and stay somewhere else the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: MR-Dublin-Ireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what we wanted. We wanted something basic at a good price which was either on or near Las Ramblas. This hotel is located at the top of Las Ramblas and directly opposite Placa Catalunya which means: - next to the starting point for the Tourist hop-on/off buses - has a bus direct to the airport ~40mins - is close to a number of large shopping centres - has Metro and Renfe stops outside the door - has McDonalds and Subway within a minute (for when you need a break from Paella and Ham & Cheese rolls) :) The hotel is entered via a watch shop and has the reception desk and elevator/stairs at the end. Don't let this put you off - I mean how useful is a gorgeous entrance to a hotel when you're on a city break. The reception speak English to a good/satisfactory level and we had no problems communicating. The hotel is very well priced considering it's location, location, location. We stayed in Room 208 and had views of Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya via our balcony which was well cool. For some this may be noisy but I like opening the balcony doors and you can hear the buskers/musicians playing away and hear the vibe of the city. If you must - sleep with earplugs. The room itself was small but reasonable in size. It was very clean and the bathroom had recently been renovated and looked new and modern. I had a few reservations when I booked this hotel as I couldn't find any photos anywhere of the room. But thankfully these fears were allayed once we got to our room. There is no tea/coffee facilities but didn't bother me as there's 100 cafe's downstairs. Only negative for us was the heating in the room was not the warmest and we asked for extra blankets - problem solved. So if you're the kind of person/couple that use your hotel room purely for storing your stuff, sleeping and showering then this is what you're looking for (and what I always go for as I'm never in the room). If you want bells, whistles and glamour then you'll need to go elsewhere and spend. Also, walking down Las Ramblas on the right hand side about 5 minutes from the hotel is a supermarket (if you want to stock your room with drinks). Also about 10minutes down Las Ramblas on the right is a fresh produce market - I recommend grabbing some fruit there as it is delicious! Hope this review helps someone decide!

Reviews.Title: “Great position for exploring the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: MikeCornish
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for an overnight stay in Barcelona for myself my son and his girlfriend. I chose it because the position--you cant miss the top of the ramblas or the plaza catalunya no matter how drunk you were and as we were there for a Marilyn Manson concert I thought finding my way home was a priority. The hotel is on one corner of the large square opposite the FNAC store -the actual door is small -just look for the McD and you will find it and yes you do go through a watch shop to get to the reception.The ladies on reception were pleasant and helpful. All rooms appear to be on floors 2+ as the lower floors are taken by offices and a sauna(!!) Our two rooms were at the back of the hotel and as such didnt have a view -the plaza is fairly noisy with traffic so I wasnt too bothered but we did have the rumbling of air condition all night. The rooms were large and clean ,relatively comfortable--no coffee making stuff was my only grouse. My room had twin basins a shower/bath and a bidet as I was on my I was at a loss what to wash first.The bathroom was spotless and appeared to have been recently tiled. Breakfast was a continental serve yourself at 7.50 euros each and was fairly good -the clockwork toaster was fun. At 60 euros a room (no reduction for single occupancy) I thought this was a reasonably good overnight stopover

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, average room”
Reviews.Author: Jools01429
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we thought it would be pretty central, and it certainly was. It's right on Las Ramblas with a great view over the square. It can be a bit noisy but its worth it. The hotel room is basic, no hairdryer, iron, kettle etc, but the room was immaculately clean and was cleaned every day. We were woke up two mornings with renovation work early on a morning - complained on checking out and they couldn't apologise enough. You enter the hotel through a watch shop which sounds a bit weird but it's certainly secure. We would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “number one for location loveridge lincoln”
Reviews.Author: philanddeb
Reviews.Content: read reviews of hotel after booking was not sure what it would be like !!!!!!!!. well if you want location you have it,right on the corner of placa catalunya and across from the well known cafe zurich.the tourist buses and the bus for the airport and plentiful taxes are all located around here the rooms are a bit basic well it is only 2 star but the amount of time we spent in the room you only need a bed anyway.had the window open most days and sat looking out over the square a small balcony if you wanted to stand out. tad noisy but the curtains when pulled drowned out most of it did not stop us sleeping. the staff spoke english and were very helpful.the buffet breakfast was plentiful, enough to have to get you set up for the day ahead. all in all if you are on a budget dont want too many frills you are not going to have time to use them then this is the place for you.dont worry about the jewellry shop entrance(handy if you need a new watch battery like i did) or the small reception the location makes up for the few deficiencies.we would certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandStewarts
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! This hotel was SO well placed, right at the corner of Playa Catalunya overlooking the square and the Ramblas. Our room was on the fourth floor and had a balcony overlooking the sights (at night we would sit and people watch with a glass of wine and the music from the outdoor entertainment playing in the cafe opposite) The room wasn't luxurious, but more than adequate. Bathroom was fine. Bed was comfy. Breakfast a bit boring, but hey, if you can't find a cafe two steps from here you really oughn't be in Barcelona! Everything was clean and the staff spoke good English and were really helpful. Tourist buses, metro and bus stops outside front door.( Must recommend the tourist bus, by the way..excellent) Hard Rock Cafe, McDonalds, restaurants of all types on doorstep. Surrounded by spectacular architecture. Only downside for those who sleep lightly, due to it's position, noise could be a problem...take some earplugs. We were there in October, so the weather was mild but not hot, so didn't test the AC, and I think you would need it mid-summer. Altogether a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible ! Don´t risk it not even to save money !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brazilian-Bunis
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the Monegal Hotel in January, 2007, for 2 nights. The place is terrible. The location in very central but not good at all. The entrance has a watch store in the front and a small reception desk in the back; making it hard even to locate the Hotel and the main entrance. The rooms are VERY small, the bathroom is terrible and has a horrible smell. We complained about it but all they did was to put some spray on it. The price is the same as other better locations and the only reason we didn´t go to another place was because it was already payed upfront. We are simple travellers, stayed in hostals in other cities but the Monegal was just a nightmare. DON´T !!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here, Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: dp123
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay for one night but the hotel is terrible. Honestly I have never seen a worse hotel. You have to walk through a tacky jewellery store to get to the reception desk. I had booked a double room and the only room they had available was a single. The room was so narrow I could not open the door fully as it banged against the single bed! The electricity did not work, muzak was playing through the room and with no identifiable way to turn it off, the room was not much longer than the single bed – it must have been a broom closet. I walked out in disgust and stayed at an amazing hotel 50 metres up the road and only 50 euro more (it was a suite) called the Catalonia Ramblas, trust me spend the few extra euros! Then they still charged me for the room! NEVER STAY IN THIS HOTEL!! Dave Plant

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Brosey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location for a short break. it may not be the most luxurious hotel, but if you are there to see the sights and don't need much more than a place to sleep and a bite to eat for breakfast then this hotel is good value for money. I took my teenage daughter there on a shopping trip and all the main shops are literally on the doorstep. We felt very safe as it is located in a busy area rather than in a back street. Very convenient to pop back to when you have too many bags to carry!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: melbguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a major disappointment. I would place it in the "hostel" category, rather than classify it as a hotel. There wasn't any lobby to speak of, the first two floors belong to a "sauna" and an office, and the rooms are impersonal, in need of fixing up, and not at all inviting. Door locks are antiquated, there's no feeling of security, and they make you pay extra to get a key for the safe (!!). We found it so depressing that we checked out after a few hours and found a different place. If it had been really cheap, I would understand, but 100 Euros a night is far too much for this place. Yes, the location is good and the room was quite clean, but it was still very bad value.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brown1000
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a review as i found this website so helpfull, and looking back, the reviews were on the mark! Me and a friend stayed at the Monegal From 30th april-3rd may, and i have to say i thought it was great! The location was one of the best i saw whilest on the trip, and was glad i had chose this hotel. The Reception staff are really friendly, and helpful, and english good too! The Room was great-although on recommendation i did request a room with Balcony, and yes it was fantastic!(2nd floor) The rooms are very clean, and well sized, the bathroom the same. A maid service daily, which was great! We had the breakfast, and that was the only thing i could fault-although good enough selection-didnt feel it was very fresh, and we only had it once. Other things recommended from us....do the tour and book from hotel, better discount. Dont eat on the ramblas every night-quite pricey (avoid le poma!) I will def come back to Hotel Monegal in fact i doubt i could stay anywhere else! Enjoy you lucky things!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Medium Monegal
HotelInfo.Address: Pelai 62 | Plaza Cataluña, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
